Lauren schrieb:
> Hi Bernd,
> You can use the TransclusionDecideRule (http://crawler.archive.org/apidocs/org/archive/crawler/deciderules/TransclusionDecideRule.html) and set the max-trans-hops and max-speculative-hops to 0. This should stop the crawler from harvesting images, frames, scripts, etc. that are not otherwise in your specified scope.
> 
> Lauren
> UNT Libraries, Digital Projects
> ________________________________________

> This explains some odd behavior.
> While crawling http://bar.foo.org/ I also saw URLs crawled from http://www.foo.org/images/.
> This is because bar.foo.org has some IMG tags pointing to www.foo.org/images/.
> 
> Not very pleased about content from sites which I don't want to have crawled at all.
> 
> Is there a strict or pedantic mode for the crawler?
> 
> Regards, Bernd
> 
> --- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com<mailto:archive-crawler%40yahoogroups.com>, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>> swschilke wrote:
>>> Dear All,
>>>
>>> Heritrix: I was reading the manual and I have a little problem
>>> understanding how I can set up a crawl job. My task would be to archive
>>> only certain pages in a crawl job, i.e., I want to give Heritrix a list of URLs referring to one page each and I want them to be collected (including all components of that page (e.g., PDF files, images, ...). Anybody here which could give me a hint / sample job definition?
>>>
>>> Thank you very much in advance
>> Roughy, this can be achieved by:
>>
>> - using the bundled default configuration
>>
>> - including all your URLs of interest as 'seeds'
>>
>> - setting the 'maxHops' value of the TooManyHopsDecideRule to '0',
>> meaning "don't follow links more than 0 hops from seeds"
>>
>> The following TransclusionDecideRule will still rule-in items that are
>> obviously required to inline-render the page (such as
>> FRAME/IMG/STYLE/SCRIPT SRC links) or even possibly-required (in the case
>> of URL-looking strings in certain form elements and scripts).
>>
>> So, the overall effect is: get exactly the URLs provided as seeds, plus
>> those things definitely necessary to render them.
>>
>> Note: "A HREF" links, whether to resources on the same site or different
>> sites, won't be ruled-in. (They'll all be considered '1' hop out, more
>> than '0' hops.) So if you have a page full of links to PDF files or
>> photos or whatever, those links won't be followed.
>>
>> Some options to consider if you want to get those:
>>
>> - increase the 'maxHops' to 1 -- this will at least follow links into
>> the same sites/site-prefixes implied by the seeds
>>
>> - add an extra MatchesRegexPatternDecideRule, late in the scope, to
>> ACCEPT all URLs with certain desired patterns (such as ending ".pdf")
>>
>> Hope this helps,
>>
>> - Gordon @ IA
>>
